Metadata: New hirsutane based sesquiterpenes from salt water cultures of a marine sponge-derived fungus and the terrestrial fungus "Coriolus consors"

In this study, five new cyclic sesquiterpenes, hirsutanols A (6), B (7), C (8), hirsutanol D (9), and "ent"- gloeosteretriol (10) and a new diketopiperazinâ€‹e (14) were isolated from salt water culture of two fungi. Sesquiterpenes 6-8 and 10 were obtained from an unidentified fungus separated from an Indo-Pacific sponge "Haliclona" sp. while 9 and 14 were produced by the terrestrial fungus "Coriolus consors" cultured under both sea water and deionized water media. Hirsutanol A (6) and "ent"- gloesteretriol (10) were found to be anti-microbial ("Bacillus subtilus") active. All structures were elucidated by spectroscopic methods.
